summary.para: Lists values that specify whether and how to cast the chart's arguments and values.
Does not cast arguments/values and displays them on the axis of the applicable type (Continuous for integer and float data types and Discrete for other data types).
Casts arguments/values to the DateTime type and displays them on the Continuous axis. To parse strings successfully, the value should match the ISO JavaScript Date pattern.
Casts arguments/values to a numeric type and displays them on the Continuous axis. To parse strings successfully, the decimal separator should be '.'.
Casts arguments/values to the String type and displays them on the Discrete axis.
Lists formats for numeric and date-time axes' labels.
Displays numbers as billions (1 000 000 000.11 → 1B).
Adds a currency symbol to a number (3.95 → $3.95).
Displays a current day (for example, 01).
Displays a day of the week (for example, Thursday).
Displays a decimal number (100.11 → 100).
Label values are not formatted.
Displays a number in exponential notation (1 000 → 1E+3).
Displays a number with a fixed point.
Displays hours (for example, 12).
Uses "Thousands", "Millions", "Billions", or "Trillions" format depending on the actual value.
Displays a date in the dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy format (for example, Thursday, January 01, 1970).
Displays a date-time value in the dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy, hh:mm:ss format (for example, Thursday, January 01, 1970, 12:00:00 AM).
Displays a time value in the hh:mm:ss format (for example, 12:00:00 AM).
Displays numbers as millions (1 000 000.11 → 1M).
Displays milliseconds (for example, 010).
Displays time in minutes (for example, 00).
Displays months (for example, January).
Displays a date in the MMMM dd format (for example, January 01).
Displays a date in the yyyy MMMM format (for example, 1970 January)
Displays numbers as percentile values (for example, 0.1 → 10%).
Displays a quarter of the year for a date (for example, QI).
Displays a quarter and year (for example, QI 1970).
Displays seconds (for example, 00).
Displays a date in the hh:mm format (for example, 12:00 AM).
Displays a date in the m/dd/yyyy, hh:mm format (for example, 1/25/1970, 12:00 AM).
Displays time in the hh:mm format (for example, "12:00 AM").
Displays numbers as thousands (1 000.11 → 1K).
Displays numbers as trillions (1 000 000 000 000 → 1T).
Displays years (for example, 1970).
Lists values that specify the chart's axis types.

Automatically detects the series's data type and uses it to render the axis. For integer and float data types, displays numeric arguments/values divided by ticks. For other data types, displays discrete arguments/values that correspond to chart points.
Displays numeric arguments/values divided by ticks.
Displays discrete arguments/values that correspond to chart points.
Displays numeric arguments/values that grow exponentially. Each axis argument/value equals to the specified logarithm base raised to a power (for instance, 10-2, 10-1, 100, 101, 102, etc.)
Initializes a new class instance.

summary.para: Lists values that specify a chart series type.
Displays data as a polyline that connects the series values. The area between the polyline and the argument axis is shaded with a color.
Displays data as a collection of rectangular bars.
Displays data as individual bubbles of different sizes.
Displays data as range bars with wicks on a chart, where Open and Close values form bar body, and Low and High values constitute upper and lower wicks.
Displays the percentage values of different point arguments as pie slices, but with a hole in its center.
Displays the percentage value of multiple area series for each argument.
Displays the percentage value of multiple bar series for each argument.
Displays the percentage value of multiple line series for each argument.
Displays the percentage value of multiple spline series for each argument.
Displays the percentage value of multiple spline area series for each argument.
Displays data as points joined by line segments.
Visualizes chart data as pie slices.
Displays series as filled areas on a diagram, with two data points that define minimum and maximum limits.
Displays value ranges that correspond to argument values. Chart data is represented as rectangles between the specified start and end value.
Displays data as a collection of points.
Displays data as points joined by a spline interpolation.
Displays data as a spline interpolation of the series values. The area between the spline and the argument axis is shaded with a color.

Displays data as a polyline that connects the series values. The area between the polyline and the argument axis (or a lower series) is shaded with a color. Different series do not overlap because their values are stacked.
Displays data as a collection of rectangular bars. Values of different series are stacked in multiple-series bars.
Displays data as points joined by line segments. Different series do not overlap because their values are stacked.
Displays data as points joined by a spline interpolation. Different series do not overlap because their values are stacked.

Displays data as a spline interpolation of the series values. The area between the spline and the argument axis (or a lower series) is shaded with a color. Different series do not overlap because their values are stacked.
Displays data as a polyline that connects the series values by horizontal and vertical line segments. The area between the polyline and the argument axis is shaded with a color.
Displays data as points joined by horizontal and vertical line segments, looking like steps.
Displays data as vertical line with Low and High values and two marks displaying Open and Close values.
Represents the tooltip's context and provides information about the hovered series point.
